description: How to contact UK Visas and Immigration (UKVI) for help with your application or immigration account, from inside and outside the UK.

details.body:
You can contact UK Visas and Immigration (UKVI) from inside or outside the UK.

Contact centre staff cannot give you advice about your personal circumstances.

nodes.body: If you are contacting UK Visas and Immigration on behalf of someone outside the UK, select ‘Outside the UK’, even if you are in the UK.

options.label: Inside the UK
Outside the UK

nodes.title: Where are you contacting UKVI from?

options.label: Applying to continue living in the UK (including settled and pre-settled status)
Viewing and proving your immigration status, right to work, or right to rent
Checking a job applicant’s right to work - for employers only
Checking a tenant's right to rent - for landlords only
Sponsoring an employee or student
Accessing your UK Visas and Immigration account
Updating your UK Visas and Immigration account details
Coronavirus (COVID-19) related visa enquiries
Getting support as an asylum seeker
Ukraine Family Scheme visa
Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme (Homes for Ukraine) visa
Ukraine Extension Scheme visa
Electronic travel authorisation (ETA)
Something else

nodes.title: What is your question about?

options.label: Applying for settled or pre-settled status (the EU Settlement Scheme)
Using the ‘UK Immigration: ID Check’ app
Using the ‘EU Exit: ID Document Check’ app
Accessing your UK Visas and Immigration account or updating your account details
Applying for British citizenship and nationality
Viewing and proving your immigration status, right to work or right to rent online
Applying for a Frontier Worker permit or Service Provider from Switzerland visa
Ukraine Family Scheme visa
Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme (Homes for Ukraine) visa
Electronic travel authorisation (ETA)
Something else

nodes.title: What do you need help with?

nodes.body:
Choose the language you want to use:

  • to speak to someone on the phone
  • to get a reply by email

options.label: English
A language other than English

options.label: Updating your UK Visas and Immigration account details
Viewing and proving your immigration status, right to work or right to rent online

options.label: Using the ‘UK Immigration: ID Check’ app
Using the ‘EU Exit: ID Document Check’ app
Changing incorrect information you submitted in your online application

Accessing your UK Visas and Immigration account

options.label: Yes - I’ve received a decision on my application

nodes.title: What is your question about?

nodes.body:
You can check your application for:

  • documents for EU nationals and family members
  • citizenship
  • family visas
  • settlement
  • work visas
  • student visas

Start now

Call the asylum customer contact centre to get an update on your asylum application.

Call the employer and educational institution helpline to get an update if you’re sponsoring an employer or a student.
nodes.title: Check your visa or immigration application status

nodes.body:
Contact Migrant Help UK if you have questions about:

  • applying for asylum support
  • weekly cash support
  • emergency cash payments
  • accommodation
  • any change in your circumstances

Migrant Help UK is a charity helpline and cannot make decisions on asylum applications. It is not part of UKVI.

Migrant Help UK
Telephone: 0808 801 0503
Monday to Friday, 8am to 8pm
(24-hour service for emergencies)
Find out about call charges
Get help through the Migrant Help UK webchat
Fill in the Migrant Help UK contact form
nodes.title: Asylum

nodes.body:
Contact the Citizenship and Nationality Enquiries team if you have questions about British citizenship, for example the Life in the UK Test.

Citizenship and Nationality Enquiries
nationalityenquiries@homeoffice.gov.uk
Telephone: +44 (0)300 790 6268 - select option 2
Monday to Thursday, 9am to 4:45pm UK local time
Friday, 9am to 4:30pm UK local time
Find out about call charges

If you cannot contact UK 0300 numbers, use +44 (0)203 875 4669.

If you’ve not had a response, check your email’s spam or junk folder before contacting UKVI again.
nodes.title: British citizenship and nationality

nodes.body:
Call UK Visas and Immigration if you have a question about living in the UK and you’re:

  • a national of an EEA country or Switzerland
  • the partner or family member of an EEA or Swiss national

UK Visas and Immigration contact centre
Telephone: 0300 790 6268
Monday to Thursday, 9am to 4:45pm
Friday, 9am to 4:30pm
Find out about call charges

If you’re from the EU, Switzerland, Norway, Iceland or Liechtenstein, you might still be able to apply to the EU Settlement Scheme if you were living in the UK by 31 December 2020. The deadline to apply for most people was 30 June 2021. You can apply if you have ‘reasonable grounds’ for not applying by the deadline - for example, you had an illness or were the victim of domestic abuse.
nodes.title: EU nationality and living in the UK

nodes.body:
Call UK Visas and Immigration about:

  • extending your stay in the UK
  • visas
  • general immigration enquiries

If you’re waiting for a decision about your visa application and it’s within the current processing time, you do not need to contact UKVI. You’ll get a letter or email when a decision has been made.

Fill in a form to get your passport or other documents back urgently.

UK Visas and Immigration contact centre
Telephone: 0300 790 6268 - select option 2
Monday to Thursday (excluding bank holidays), 9am to 4:45pm
Friday (excluding bank holidays), 9am to 4:30pm
Find out about call charges
nodes.title: General immigration enquiries

nodes.body:
Contact UK Visas and Immigration if you have a question about indefinite leave to remain (ILR).

UK Visas and Immigration contact centre
Telephone: 0300 790 6268
Monday to Thursday, 9am to 4:45pm
Friday, 9am to 4:30pm
Find out about call charges
nodes.title: Indefinite leave to remain

nodes.body:
Contact the business helpline for information about sponsoring an employee or student.

Business helpline

Telephone: 0300 123 4699
Monday to Friday, 9am to 4pm
Weekends and bank holidays: Closed
Find out about call charges

You can also email:

  • businesshelpdesk@homeoffice.gov.uk - if you’re an employer
  • educatorshelpdesk@homeoffice.gov.uk - if you’re from an educational institution

If you’ve not had a response, check your email’s spam or junk folder before contacting UKVI again.
nodes.title: Sponsoring an employee or student

nodes.body:
You can contact UK Visas and Immigration (UKVI) about technical problems during your online application or after you’ve applied, for example if you get error pages or cannot access your account.

The way you contact UKVI depends on what your problem is about.

There’s a different way to contact UKVI about these problems if you’re applying to the EU Settlement Scheme.

Problems with applying for a British National Overseas (BNO) visa

Before you contact UKVI, read the guidance about applying for a BNO visa.

Problems with the ‘ID Check’ app or your online immigration account

Get help if you have a problem:

  • using the ‘UK Immigration: ID Check’ app - read the guidance on using the app before you contact UKVI
  • viewing and proving your immigration status, right to work or right to rent online
  • updating your UK Visas and Immigration account details
  • accessing your UKVI account

You can call UKVI.

UK Visas and Immigration contact centre
Telephone: 0300 790 6268
Monday to Friday (excluding bank holidays), 8am to 8pm
Saturday and Sunday, 9:30am to 4:30pm
Find out about call charges

Other technical problems with your application

Email the online help team on ApplyOnlineE-Support@homeoffice.gov.uk to report technical problems with your online application.

Get help if you have:

  • made a mistake in your online application
  • problems logging into your account or with your password
  • problems with making a payment to UKVI online or pending payments
  • questions about your sponsor licence number
  • other technical problems with your application

There’s a different way to get help if you have a general immigration question after you’ve submitted your application.

You must include:

  • your name
  • what you are applying for (for example, a Student visa)
  • a description of the problem

Include screenshots of the problem, if you can.

You’ll usually hear back within one working day.

If you’ve not had a response, check your email’s spam or junk folder before contacting UKVI again.
nodes.title: Technical problems with your online application, account or status (excludes EU Settlement Scheme)

nodes.body:
Call the UK Visas and Immigration contact centre about:

  • extending your stay in the UK
  • general immigration enquiries
  • work and study visas

Fill in a form to get your passport or other documents back urgently.

UK Visas and Immigration contact centre
Telephone: 0300 790 6268
Monday to Thursday, 9am to 4:45pm
Friday, 9am to 4:30pm
Find out about call charges
nodes.title: Visas (work, study and extensions)

nodes.body:
You can contact UK Visas and Immigration (UKVI) about problems during your application or after you’ve applied.

The way you contact UKVI depends on what your problem is about. You may have to pay a fee.

Contact centre staff cannot give you advice about your personal circumstances.

Problems with your British National Overseas (BNO) visa application

Before you contact UKVI, read the guidance about applying for a BNO visa.

Problems with the ‘ID Check’ app or your online immigration account

Get help if you have a problem:

  • using the ‘UK Immigration: ID Check’ app - read the guidance on using the app before you contact UKVI
  • viewing and proving your immigration status, right to work or right to rent online
  • updating your UK Visas and Immigration account details

There’s a different way to contact UKVI about these problems if you’re applying to the EU Settlement Scheme.

You can call UKVI.

UK Visas and Immigration contact centre
Telephone: +44 (0)300 790 6268
Monday to Friday (excluding bank holidays), 8am to 8pm UK local time
Saturday and Sunday, 9:30am to 4:30pm UK local time
Find out about call charges

If you cannot contact UK 0300 numbers, use +44 (0)203 875 4669.

Questions about applying or problems with your application

Get help if you have:

  • general queries about immigrating to the UK
  • questions about the progress of your application
  • technical problems with your application
  • made a mistake in your online application
  • problems logging into your account or with your password
  • problems with making a payment to UKVI online or pending payments

Online

Contact UK Visas and Immigration online.

Queries cost £2.74. You will not be charged for any follow-up emails about the same enquiry.

You will get a reply to your query within 5 days, except on Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays and UK public holidays.

If you’ve not had a response within 5 working days, check your email’s spam or junk folder before contacting UKVI again.

By phone

You can get help on the phone with English-speaking staff.

Telephone: +44 (0)300 790 6268
Monday to Friday, 24 hours
Calls cost 69 pence per minute on top of your standard network charges

If you cannot contact UK 0300 numbers, use +44 (0)203 875 4669.

If you’re applying to the EU Settlement Scheme

Get help with:

  • questions about how to apply to the EU Settlement Scheme
  • technical problems while applying online, including problems with the ‘ID Check’ app or your online immigration account
  • questions about an application that you’ve submitted

Online

Contact the Resolution Centre online

By phone

You can also get help on the phone with English-speaking staff.

The phone number is different if you’re from a local council or another organisation helping other people to apply.

If you’re calling from inside the UK

Telephone: 0300 123 7379
Monday to Friday (excluding bank holidays), 8am to 8pm UK local time
Saturday and Sunday, 9:30am to 4:30pm UK local time
Find out about call charges

If you’re calling from outside the UK

Telephone: +44 (0)20 3080 0010
Monday to Friday (excluding bank holidays), 8am to 8pm UK local time
Saturday and Sunday, 9:30am to 4:30pm UK local time
Find out about call charges

If you’re from an organisation helping others to apply

Telephone: 0300 790 0566
Monday to Friday (excluding bank holidays), 8am to 8pm UK local time
Saturday and Sunday, 9:30am to 4:30pm UK local time
Find out about call charges
nodes.title: Contact UK Visas and Immigration in English

nodes.body:
If you have a question about your application you can contact staff who speak:

  • Arabic
  • Cantonese
  • French
  • Hindi
  • Mandarin
  • Russian
  • Spanish

Contact centre staff cannot give you advice about your personal circumstances.

Online

You can send an online query to UK Visas and Immigration (UKVI).

Contact UK Visas and Immigration online.

Online queries cost £2.74. You’ll not be charged for any follow-up emails about the same enquiry.

You’ll get a reply to your query within 5 days, except on Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays and UK public holidays.

If you’ve not had a response within 5 working days, check your email’s spam or junk folder before contacting UKVI again.

By phone

You can call UKVI.

UK Visas and Immigration contact centre
Telephone: +44 (0)300 790 6268
Calls cost 69 pence per minute on top of your standard network charges.

If you cannot contact UK 0300 numbers, use +44 (0)203 875 4669.

When you can call depends on which language you speak.

Arabic

Sunday to Thursday, 5am to 1pm UK local time.

Cantonese

Monday to Friday, 1am to 9am UK local time.

French

Monday to Friday, 9am to 5pm UK local time.

Hindi

Monday to Friday, 4am to midday UK local time.

Mandarin

Monday to Friday, 1am to 9am UK local time.

Russian

Monday to Friday, 6am to 2pm UK local time.

Spanish 

Monday to Friday, 1pm to 1am UK local time.
nodes.title: Contact UK Visas and Immigration in a language other than English

nodes.body:

Employer enquiry helpline

Online

If you’ve not had a response, check your email’s spam or junk folder before contacting UKVI again.

By phone

Monday to Friday (excluding bank holidays), 8am to 8.30pm UK local time

Get help using a computer to apply online

You can get support over the phone from We Are Digital if you need help filling in the settlement scheme application form online. You may need to book a phone appointment.

We Are Digital
visa@we-are-digital.co.uk
Telephone: 03333 445 675
Monday to Friday, 9am to 6pm
Find out about call charges
nodes.title: EU Settlement Scheme, Frontier Worker permit or Service Provider from Switzerland visa applications

nodes.body:
If you’re in the UK with a visa or short visa extension (known as ‘exceptional assurance’), you can ask to stay for longer if both the following apply:

  • your visa or short visa extension expires before 31 October 2022
  • you’re returning to a country that you cannot enter because of coronavirus (COVID-19) restrictions there

Ask for a short extension.

Call UK Visas and Immigration if you have questions about your visa that are related to COVID-19.

UK Visas and Immigration contact centre
Telephone: 0300 790 6268 - select option 2
Monday to Thursday (excluding bank holidays), 9am to 4:45pm
Friday (excluding bank holidays), 9am to 4:30pm
Find out about call charges

nodes.body:
Read the guidance on using the app before you contact UKVI.

Call UK Visas and Immigration

All times are UK local time. The contact centre is closed on bank holidays.

nodes.title: Help with accessing your UK Visas and Immigration account or updating your account details

nodes.body:
Get help if you have:

  • general queries about applying for a visa to come to the UK
  • waited longer than the usual processing time for your visa
  • technical problems with your application
  • made a mistake in your online application
  • problems logging into your account or with your password
  • problems with making a payment to UKVI online or pending payments

Contact centre staff cannot give you advice about your personal circumstances.

If you’re applying for a British National Overseas (BNO) visa, read the guidance about applying for a BNO visa before you contact UKVI.

Online

Contact UK Visas and Immigration online.

Queries cost £2.74. You will not be charged for any follow-up emails about the same enquiry.

You will get a reply to your query within 5 days, except on Fridays, Saturdays, Sundays and UK public holidays.

If you’ve not had a response within 5 working days, check your email’s spam or junk folder before contacting UKVI again.

By phone

You can get help on the phone with English-speaking staff.

Telephone: +44 (0)300 790 6268 - select option 1
Monday to Friday, 24 hours
Calls cost 69 pence per minute on top of your standard network charges

If you cannot contact UK 0300 numbers, use +44 (0)203 875 4669.
nodes.title: Help with your visa application or other problems

nodes.body:
Get help with:

  • questions about how to apply to the EU Settlement Scheme
  • questions about how to apply for a Frontier Worker permit or Service Provider from Switzerland visa
  • technical problems while applying online, including problems with the ‘EU Exit: ID Document Check’ app or your online immigration account
  • questions about an application that you’ve submitted

Online

Contact the Resolution Centre online

If you’ve not had a response, check your email’s spam or junk folder before contacting UKVI again.

By phone

You can also get help on the phone with English-speaking staff.

Telephone: +44 (0)20 3080 0010
Monday to Friday (excluding bank holidays), 8am to 8.30pm UK local time
Saturday and Sunday, 9:30am to 4:30pm UK local time
Find out about call charges

The phone number is different if you’re from a local council or another organisation helping other people to apply.

If you’re from an organisation helping others to apply

Telephone: +44 (0)300 790 0566
Monday to Friday (excluding bank holidays), 8am to 8.30pm UK local time
Saturday and Sunday, 9:30am to 4:30pm UK local time
Find out about call charges
nodes.title: Help with applying to the EU Settlement Scheme

nodes.body:
Get help if you have a problem viewing and proving your immigration status, right to work or right to rent online.

Call UK Visas and Immigration

All times are UK local time. The contact centre is closed on bank holidays.

UK Visas and Immigration contact centre
Telephone: +44 (0)300 790 6268 - select option 3
Telephone: +44 (0)203 875 4669, if you are unable to dial 0300 numbers
Monday to Friday, 8am to 8.30pm
Saturday and Sunday, 9:30am to 4:30pm

nodes.title: Help with viewing and proving your immigration status, right to work or right to rent online

nodes.body:
Get help if you:

  • have submitted incorrect information in your online application and you need to change it
  • are having problems making a payment to UKVI online or pending payments
  • are having problems entering your sponsor licence number online
  • are making an online application and you cannot log in to your UKVI account
  • need other technical support (for example with an error message on the online application)

Email the online help team on ApplyOnlineE-Support@homeoffice.gov.uk.

You must include:

  • your name
  • what you are applying for (for example, a Student visa)
  • a description of the problem

Include screenshots of the problem, if you can.

You’ll usually hear back within one working day.

If you’ve not had a response, check your email’s spam or junk folder before contacting UKVI again.

nodes.title: Problems with the online service for checking a tenant’s right to rent

nodes.body:
Get help with applying for a Ukraine Family Scheme visa, if you or someone you know wants to:

  • come to the UK from Ukraine
  • stay longer in the UK (if they’re already here)

You can speak to someone in Ukrainian if you need to.

Telephone: + 44 808 164 8810 – select option 1
Monday to Thursday, 9am to 4:45pm
Friday, 9am to 4:30pm
Closed on bank holidays
Calls are free of charge

If you cannot contact UK 0808 numbers, use +44 175 390 7510 (select option 1). You may have to pay - check with your phone provider.

Read guidance on how to apply for a Ukraine Family Scheme visa. This guidance is also available in Ukrainian and in Russian.
nodes.title: Ukraine Family Scheme visa

nodes.body:
Get help with applying for a Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme (Homes for Ukraine) visa, if you’re:

  • fleeing Ukraine and currently outside the UK
  • a UK resident sponsoring someone under the Homes for Ukraine scheme

You can speak to someone in Ukrainian if you need to.

If you’re fleeing Ukraine and outside the UK

Telephone: + 44 808 164 8810 – select option 1
Monday to Thursday, 9am to 4:45pm
Friday, 9am to 4:30pm
Closed on bank holidays
Calls are free of charge

If you cannot contact UK 0808 numbers, use +44 175 390 7510 (select option 2). You may have to pay - check with your phone provider.

Read guidance on how to apply for a Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme (Homes for Ukraine) visa. This guidance is also available in Ukrainian and in Russian.

If you’re a UK resident sponsoring someone

To get help with applying for a Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme (Homes for Ukraine) visa:

Telephone: + 44 808 164 8810 – select option 3
Monday to Thursday, 9am to 4:45pm
Friday, 9am to 4:30pm
Saturday and Sunday, 9am to 5:30pm
Closed on bank holidays
Calls are free of charge

If you cannot contact UK 0808 numbers, use +44 175 390 7510 (select option 3). You may have to pay - check with your phone provider.

Read the Homes for Ukraine sponsor guidance if you have questions about being a sponsor.
nodes.title: Ukraine Sponsorship Scheme (Homes for Ukraine) visa

nodes.body:
Get help with applying for a Ukraine Extension Scheme visa if you’re already in the UK on a:

  • valid UK visa
  • visa that expired on or after 1 January 2022

You can speak to someone in Ukrainian if you need to.

Telephone: + 44 808 164 8810 – select option 1
Monday to Thursday, 9am to 4:45pm
Friday, 9am to 4:30pm
Closed on bank holidays
Calls are free of charge

If you cannot contact UK 0808 numbers, use +44 175 390 7510 (select option 1). You may have to pay - check with your phone provider.

Read guidance on how to apply for a Ukraine Extension Scheme visa. This guidance is also available in Ukrainian and in Russian.
nodes.title: Ukraine Extension Scheme visa

nodes.body:
Read the guidance on applying for electronic travel authorisation (ETA) before you contact UK Visas and Immigration (UKVI) for help. 

If you are waiting for a decision on an ETA application, do not contact UKVI until 3 working days (Monday to Friday) after you applied.

Contact UKVI online if you cannot find an answer to your question in the guidance.

You’ll need: 

  • an email address
  • your ETA reference number, if you’ve already applied

Contact UKVI online.

UKVI cannot help with ETA applications over the phone. 

You must apply for an ETA before you travel to the UK. You can travel to the UK while waiting for a decision.

You’ll get a reply to your query within 3 working days, except on UK public holidays.

If you’ve not had a response within 3 working days, check your email’s spam or junk folder before contacting UKVI again.
nodes.title: Electronic travel authorisation (ETA)
